meanings.definition: To spend the summer in a state of torpor or dormancy.
meanings.sent1: During the hot months, the bear aestivates in its cozy den.
meanings.sent2: The turtle aestivates in the sand to escape the scorching sun.
meanings.sent3: The lazy cat aestivates all day, avoiding any activity.
meanings.sent4: The old car aestivates in the garage, waiting for restoration.
meanings.sent5: The plant aestivates in the dry soil, conserving energy for the next season.

meanings.sent2: Many animals aestivate during the hottest hours of the day.

meanings.sent4: The old clock aestivates in the attic, its gears slowly rusting.
